definitions.text: the property of being physically or mentally strong
capability in terms of personnel and materiel that affect the capacity to fight a war
examples: we faced an army of great strength
politicians have neglected our military posture
he hit with all the force he could muster
it was destroyed by the strength of the gale
a government has not the vitality and forcefulness of a living man

definitions.text: an asset of special worth or utility
the power to induce the taking of a course of action or the embracing of a point of view by means of argument or entreaty
examples: the strength of his argument settled the matter

definitions.text: the amount of energy transmitted (as by acoustic or electromagnetic radiation)
examples: he adjusted the intensity of the sound
they measured the station's signal strength

definitions.text: capacity to produce strong physiological or chemical effects

examples: the strength of the company's stock in recent weeks

definitions.text: permanence by virtue of the power to resist stress or force
examples: they advertised the durability of their products
